sentences.sContent: Let me know when they come.
Can you come here for a minute?
sentences.sCn: 你到这里来一会儿好吗？

sentences.sContent: Come a bit closer and you’ll be able to see better.
sentences.sCn: 靠近一些就能看得更清楚。

sentences.sContent: What time will you be coming home ?
...Small signs may indicate great changes to come and therefore merit attention...
...People would come in out of a formal and almost Victorian attitude...
...Often the best ideas for big changes come from unexpected places — it’s just a matter of tuning in...
...Our fellow students have just come out of high school...
...I hope that you and your family would come and visit America one day...
...But if we come up with an answer...
...so we’ll come back to this question...
...What will happen when the proposed measure come into effect...
...The parents come out barefoot and screaming...

synos.tran: 来；开始；出现；发生；变成；到达

phrases.pCn: 回来；记起；恢复原状，重新流行
v. 快点；开始；要求；上演；跟着来；突然产生
走近；发生；开始；上升；发芽；被提出
与……一起供给；伴随……发生；从……开始
下来，降落；流传下来；倒塌；落泊，失势
走进；险些；可与…相比（多用于否定句）
为某种目的而来取；向…冲来；对…进行袭击
v. 偶遇；无意中发现；讲得清楚明白；[口]给人…印象

words.tran: 即将到来的；接着的；前途有望的
来者，来的人；有成功希望的人

trans.tranOther: to move towards you or arrive at the place where you are
